SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc12
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.Server

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.Room
it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Model.Server.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Listenable, Serializable
public class Game extends Room implements Listenable
Represents a game session after it has started, keeping track of the players in the associated game lobby.

This class extends the Room class and manages the state of the game after it has started. It tracks the players in the game lobby, manages decks of cards, and maintains players' information related to the game, such as their hands, fields, and secret objectives. Additionally, it oversees the current state of the game, including round information and active player status.

As an implementation of the Listenable interface, this class supports listener registration, removal, and notification for various game events such as card placements and player actions.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(Lobby lobby)
      Constructs a new Game instance from the specified lobby. Initializes decks, shuffles players, and sets up the game state.
      Parameters:
      lobby - The Lobby instance from which this game is created.

  • Method Details

    • toLobby

      public Lobby toLobby()
      Converts the current game state back to a lobby state. This method is useful for scenarios where the players in-game need to be converted in player instances, such as after a game ends and players return to a lobby.
      Returns:
      A new Lobby instance reflecting only the current active players.

      public void nextPlayer()

    • generateSecretObjectivesSelection

      public Map<InGamePlayer,ArrayList<ObjectiveCard>> generateSecretObjectivesSelection()
      Generates a selection of two secret objective cards for each player in the game.
      Returns:
      A map where each player is associated with a list of two objective cards.

    • placeCard

      public void placeCard(InGamePlayer target, GenericPair<Integer,Integer> coordinates, PlayableCard card, Side playedSide) throws InvalidCardPositionException, NotEnoughResourcesException, CardNotInHandException
      Places a card on the specified coordinates for the given player and notifies listeners with a PlaceCardCommand.
      Parameters:
      target - The player who is placing the card.
      coordinates - The coordinates where the card is to be placed.
      card - The card to be placed.
      playedSide - The side of the card that is being played.
      Throws:
      InvalidCardPositionException - If the card cannot be placed at the specified coordinates.
      NotEnoughResourcesException - If the player does not have enough resources to place the card.
      CardNotInHandException - If the player does not have the specified card in their hand.

    • drawFrom

      public <T extends Card> T drawFrom(CardDeck<T> deck) throws EmptyDeckException
      Draws a card from the specified deck.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of cards in the deck.
      Parameters:
      deck - The deck to draw from.
      Returns:
      The drawn card of type T.
      Throws:
      EmptyDeckException - if the deck is empty.

    • drawFrom

      public PlayableCard drawFrom(PlayableCard[] deck, int position) throws EmptyDeckException
      Draws a card from the specified deck at a given position and replaces it with a new card from the appropriate deck. If the deck to draw from is empty, the position in the deck will be set to null.

      Notifies all the listeners with a ReplaceCardsCommand.

      Parameters:
      deck - The array of visible cards from which to draw.
      position - The position of the card to draw.
      Returns:
      The drawn card.
      Throws:
      EmptyDeckException - if the specified position in the visible cards is empty.

    • peekFrom

      public <T extends Card> T peekFrom(CardDeck<T> deck)
      Peeks at the top card of the specified deck without removing it.

      Notifies all the listeners with a ReplaceCardsCommand showing the top card of the deck.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of cards in the deck.
      Parameters:
      deck - The deck to peek from.
      Returns:
      The top card of type T.

    • setPlayerActivity

      public void setPlayerActivity(InGamePlayer target, boolean isActive)
      Changes the active status of the specified player to the given activity status, and notifies listeners of this change with a SetPlayerActivityCommand.
      Parameters:
      target - The player whose active status is to be toggled.
      isActive - The new value for the player's activity status.

    • addListener

      public void addListener(Listener listener)
      Adds a listener to the list of game listeners.

      This method ensures thread-safe addition of listeners to the list.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to be added.

    • removeListener

      public void removeListener(Listener listener)

    • notifyListeners

      public void notifyListeners(ClientCommand command)
      Notifies all registered listeners with the specified command.

      This method ensures thread-safe iteration over the listeners list while notifying them.

      Specified by:
      notifyListeners in interface Listenable
      Parameters:
      command - The command to be sent to all listeners.

    • generateDTO

      public ClientGame generateDTO(InGamePlayer receiver)
      Creates an instance of Client, which contains only the essential information needed by a client to correctly create and manage its local instance of the game. The generated Data Transfer Object (DTO) will include only the relevant personal information of the specified player.
      Parameters:
      receiver - The player for whom the DTO is created. The relevant information in the DTO will pertain to this player.
      Returns:
      A Client instance containing the necessary information for the specified player.

    • generateTemporaryFieldsToPlayers

      public Map<String,LinkedHashMap<GenericPair<Integer,Integer>,GenericPair<Integer,Side>>> generateTemporaryFieldsToPlayers()
      Generates a temporary map of fields to players. This map contains only the ID associated to the placed cards for each player, where each player's field is represented as a LinkedHashMap with specific key-value pairs indicating card placements.
      Returns:
      A map where each key is a player's nickname and each value is a LinkedHashMap representing that player's field.
